text: travel fees are a part of life but
during my recent travels for the getaway
column I've noticed that all those
little extra costs are really adding up
for example during recent stay at a
hotel I notice that in addition to the
resort or service charge fee of fourteen
dollars a day I also was billed for a
newspaper that I didn't request turns
out the burden was on me to opt out of
those charges the travel industry has
been slowly increasing fees and
surcharges like that newspaper charge at
airports and hotels while some fees like
extra baggage or drinks on the plane are
expected new fees keep popping up
tourists visiting New York are feeling
the sting everywhere you go they say
well you know money and the exchange and
there's always an excuse for the fees to
go up you have to be wise and ask the
questions and make sure stuff are
included because if it's not you might
be surprised once you get here hotels
alone collected 1.85 billion in fees
last year up over fifty percent from the
year 2000 according to professor and
hotel industry expert Bjorn Hansen
hotels been continuing to spend money on
innovations and new services flat-screen
TVs high-speed Internet access improved
bedding and those types of improvements
at the same time rates are actually
lower in 2012 for the country average of
about one hundred and six dollars
compared to two thousand eight at one
hundred and seven dollars so hotels are
looking for other ways to generate
revenue and fees and surcharges are one
of the answers for example in addition
to paying for that drink from your
minibar you may also be charged a
restocking fee on top of it some hotels
will also ask you to pay if you want to
leave your bags with the bell men after
checkout one guest of the Waldorf
Astoria New York told me that he would
have to pay for Wi-Fi by device that's
fifteen dollars a day for your phone and
another 15 for your iPad and those
reservation cancellations and ticket
changing fees they all add up to 2.3
billion dollars a year for the airline
and
tree while travel providers are trying
to increase profits customers are
wondering why fees aren't just part of
the initial quoted price I think they
should be included like internet for
example yes but if you have to pay for
them maybe they should tell you in
advance what really has happened is
because of the internet it is so easy
for guests to research rates and a rate
difference of two dollars will shift
market share so hotels competing on
rates will find other ways to raise
revenue and many of the fees and
surcharges are really optional to not
paid by all guests in January the
Transportation Department gave fliers a
break the department now requires that
airlines disclose mandatory fees in
published airfare prices and they've
already find Travelocity and TripAdvisor
for violating those regulations but
disclosures are only required on
mandatory fees so it is the travelers
responsibility to be aware of all of
those so-called optional charges so let
me give you a couple of tips one
remember that nowadays you have 24 hours
to cancel a flight reservation without
being charged a penalty and also as part
of that and sometimes it may be cheaper
for you to buy a whole new ticket rather
than pay a change fee for your existing
ticket and when it comes to Wi-Fi at
hotels even though the hotel may charge
you a fee for using Wi-Fi in your room
those same hotels sometimes offer it for
free in the lobby or the pool area in
which case take your laptop and head to
that lamb chair
you
